title.narrative: Emergency Protection of the Kaiser Library Collections and Post-Earthquake Stabilization of the Late-19th-Century Kaiser Mahal in Kathmandu

description.narrative: Since the late 1960s, the Kaiser Mahal has been home to the Kaiser Library, one of Nepals oldest libraries. This project, which involves emergency stabilization of the south wing of the building and the protection of books, maps, manuscripts, furnishings, and other objects in the library, directly supports the U.S. embassys efforts to strengthen U.S. cooperation with the government and people of Nepal on disaster risk reduction and response.

title.narrative: Evidence-Led Actions

description.narrative: The Freedom Fund will work to substantively and measurably reduce the prevalence of modern slavery. Improve the knowledge base on the prevalence, causes and consequences of modern slavery; select, fund and monitor the most effective and transformational interventions to reduce the prevalence of forced labor of children and adults; disrupt, through sub-awards to the most effective frontline organizations, the norms and systems that sustain forced labor of children and adults; enable, through sub-awards to the most effective frontline organizations, the sustained recovery of children and adult survivors of forced labor; and amplify the impact of PEMS through sharing knowledge and evidence about forced labor of children and adults.

title.narrative: Conservation of Ethnographic Objects at Changu Narayan

title.narrative: Documentation of the 17th-Century Kartik Nach

description.narrative: To support the documentation of the 17th-century Kartik Nach, a month-long dance originally commissioned for and performed at the former Patan Royal Palace. The dance showcases Nepals ethnic diversity, yet with the last full performance of the dance in 1949 only a very few performers survive who understand the dance in its entirety. This project includes the comprehensive documentation of the Kartik Nach and the transmission of the tradition through training workshops.

description.narrative: Built in 1907 as an addition to the Hanuman Dhoka, the royal residence of Nepali kings, and damaged during the April 2015 Nepal Earthquake, the Gaddi Baithak is one of the most prominent monuments in Kathmandu Durbar Square. title.narrative: Conservation of Ancient and Historic Hitis (Stepwells) in the Kathmandu Valley

description.narrative: Traditional public stepwells, or hitis, have provided water to communities in the Kathmandu Valley for over 1,500 years. This project involves the conservation and reactivation of a section of the stepwell network to restore its socio-cultural significance and support modern communities adversely impacted by mounting water insecurity.

title.narrative: "Together for Protection" Project

description.narrative: This project will focus on improving protection, prosecution and standards of care in childrens homes (including orphanages where child trafficking is potentially present) by strengthening provincial and local anti-HT and CP structures and mechanisms. To this end, it will work with regulatory bodies at all three levels (national, provincial and local) formed under the Childrens Act 2018 and those to be created through amendment of the Human Trafficking and Transportation (Control) Act (HTTCA) 2007, to develop or update regulatory frameworks governing child institutionalization and human trafficking. The project will also facilitate integration of regulatory frameworks at local levels. Survivor-civic engaged accountability measures will be set up to pressure government and key stakeholders for a pro-active response to ensure that childrens homes are monitored by authorities, operate under minimum standards and integrate adequate protection mechanisms against child trafficking and risks of voluntourism and all persons involved in crimes are prosecuted regardless of their status and position.

title.narrative: Global Peace Operations Initiative: Stimson Center Hybrid Generator Project

description.narrative: The GPOI program enhances international capacity to effectively conduct United Nations and regional peace operations. International peace operations are strategically important to U.S. national security and foreign policy objectives. The GPOI program is the primary mechanism through which the United States contributes to strengthening global capacity to conduct peace operations. The program's partnerships emphasize institutional capacity-building relationships and seek to strengthen partner countries' capabilities to self-sufficiently train, deploy, employ, and sustain peacekeeping forces.

title.narrative: Restoration of the 17th- and 18th-Century Patan Royal Palace, Phase 2

description.narrative: To support the continuation of work begun under a previous Ambassadors Fund grant to restore the Patan Royal Palace, one of South Asias most intact historic urban royal ensembles. Major earthquakes in 1833 and 1934 and decades of neglect and disuse have left their mark on the palace, most of which dates from the 17th and 18th centuries. This phase includes the restoration of the late 18th-century Bahadur Shah palace wing.
